column1: Kanasín Municipality (In the Yucatec Maya Language: “tense or strongly tightened”) is one of the 106 municipalities in the Mexican state of Yucatán containing  (72.81 km2) of land and located roughly 5 km east of the city of Mérida.

It is unknown which chieftainship the area was under prior to the arrival of the Spanish. After the conquest the area became part of the encomienda system. One of the first encomenderos was Francisco Sosa
column2: with 209 Indians in his charge. Later it passed to Josefa Díaz Bolio
column3: who had care of 211 Indians and then to reverend Sister María Josefa
column4: with 155 Indians.Yucatán declared its independence from the Spanish Crown in 1821 and in 1825
column5: Kanasín was established as head of its own municipality.

column1: The municipal president is elected for a three-year term. The town council has nine councilpersons
column2: who serve as Secretary and councilors of policing and neighborhoods
column10: and nomenclature.The Municipal Council administers the business of the municipality. It is responsible for budgeting and expenditures and producing all required reports for all branches of the municipal administration. Annually it determines educational standards for schools.The Police Commissioners ensure public order and safety. They are tasked with enforcing regulations
column11: distributing materials and administering rulings of general compliance issued by the council.

column1: The head of the municipality is Kanasín
column2: Yucatán.  There are 76 inhabited placed in the municipality. Some of the more important ones include Habal
